Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Internal pressure positive.  Assume nominal hull integrity.  Hypersleep capsules, style circa late twenties...

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Lights are green.  She's alive. Well, there goes out salvage, guys.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Terrible.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How long have I been on Gateway station?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Jones!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Come here Jonesy you ugly old moose...you ugly thing.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Nice room.  I'm Burke.  Carter Burke. I work for the company, but other than that I'm an okay guy.  Glad to see you're feeling better.  I'm told the weakness and disorientation should pass soon.  Side effects of the unusually long hypersleep, or something like that.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How long was I out there?  They won't tell me anything.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Well, maybe you shouldn't worry about that just yet.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: All right.  My instinct says you're strong enough to handle this...Fifty-seven years.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Fifty-seven...oh, Christ...

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: You'd drifted right through the core systems.  It's blind luck that deep-salvage team caught you when they...are you all right?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No...noooo!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Hold her...Get me an airway, stat! And fifteen cc's of...Jesus!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No.. I've slept enough.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: We made it, Jones.  We made it.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Dumbshit.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Sorry...I've been running behind all morning.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Have they located my daughter yet?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Well, I was going to wait until after the inquest...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Is she...?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Amy.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Cancer.  Hmmmm.  They still haven't licked that one.  Cremated.  Interred Parkside Repository, Little Chute, Wisconsin.  No children.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I promised her I'd be home for her birthday.  Her eleventh birthday.  I sure missed that one.  Well...she has already learned to take my promises with a grain of salt.  When it came to flight schedules, anyway.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You always think you can make it up to somebody...later, you know. But now I never can.  I never can.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: The hearing convenes at 0930.  You don't want to be late.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You read my deposition...it's complete and accurate.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Look, I believe you, but there are going to be some heavyweights in there.  You got Feds, you got interstellar commerce commission, you got colonial administration, insurance company guys...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I get the picture.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Just tell them what happened.  The important thing is to stay cool and unemotional.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Do you people have earwax, of what?  We have been here three hours.  How many different ways do you want me to tell the same story?

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Look at it from our perspective. You freely admit to detonating the engines of, and thereby destroying, an M-Class star-freighter.  A rather expensive piece of hardware...

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: The shuttle's flight recorder corroborates some elements of your account.  That the Nostromo set down on LV-426, an unsurveyed planet, at that time.  That repairs were made.  That it resumed its course and was subsequently set for self-destruct.  By you.  For reasons unknown.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Look, I told you...

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: It did not, however, contain any entries concerning the hostile life form you allegedly picked up.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Then somebody's gotten to it... doctored the recorder.  Who had access to it?

Speaker: eca rep
Dialogue: Would you just listen to yourself for one minute.

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: The analysis team which went over your shuttle centimeter by centimeter found no physical evidence of the creature you describe...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Like I said.

Speaker: insurance man
Dialogue: Are there any species like this 'hostile organism' on LV-426?

Speaker: eca rep
Dialogue: No.  It's a rock.  No indigenous life larger than a simple virus.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I told you, it wasn't indigenous. There was an alien spacecraft there. A derelict ship.  We homed on its beacon...

Speaker: eca rep
Dialogue: To be perfectly frank, we've surveyed over three hundred worlds and no one's ever reported a creature which, using your words...  ...'gestates in a living human host' and has 'concentrated molecular acid for blood.'

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Look, I can see where this is going.  But I'm telling you those things exist.  Back on that planetoid is an alien ship and on that ship are thousands of eggs.  Thousands. Do you understand?  I suggest you find it, using the flight recorder's data.  Find it and deal with it -- before one of your survey teams comes back with a little surprise...

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Thank you, Officer Ripley.  That will be...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: ...because just one of those things managed to kill my entire crew, within twelve hours of hatching...

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Thank you, that will be all.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: That's not all, Goddamnit!  If those things get back here, that will be all.  Then you can just kiss it good-bye, Jack!  Just kiss it goodbye.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: You had them eating out of your hand, kiddo.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They had their minds made up before I even went in there. They think I'm a head case.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: You are a head case.  Have a donut.

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: It is the finding of this board of inquiry that Warrent Officer Ellen Ripley, NOC-14672. has acted with questionable judgment and is unfit to hold an ICC license as a commercial flight officer.

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Said license is hereby suspended indefinitely.  No criminal charges will be filed at this time and you are released on own recognizance for a six month period of psychometric probation, to include monthly review by an ICC psychiatric tech...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Why won't you check out LV-426?

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Because I don't have to.  The people who live there checked it out years ago and they never reported and 'hostile organism' or alien ship.  And by the way, they call it Acheron now.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What are you talking about. What people?

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Terraformers...planet engineers. It's what we call a shake 'n' bake colony.  They set up atmosphere processors to make the air breathable...big job.  Takes decades.  They've already been there over twenty years.  Peacefully.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How many colonists?

Speaker: van leuwen
Dialogue: Sixty, maybe seventy families.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Sweet Jesus.

Speaker: elevator passenger
Dialogue: Do you mind?

Speaker: lydecker
Dialogue: You remember you sent some wildcatters out to that plateau, out past the Ilium range, a couple days ago?

Speaker: simpson
Dialogue: Yeah.  What?

Speaker: lydecker
Dialogue: There's a guy on the horn, mom-and-pop survey team.  Says he's homing on something and wants to know if his claim will be honored.

Speaker: simpson
Dialogue: Christ.  Some honch in a cushy office on Earth says go look at a grid reference in the middle of nowhere, we look.  They don't say why, and I don't ask.  I don't ask because it takes two weeks to get an answer out here and the answer's always 'don't ask.'

Speaker: lydecker
Dialogue: So what do I tell this guy?

Speaker: simpson
Dialogue: Tell him, as far as I'm concerned, he finds something it's his.

Speaker: jorden
Dialogue: Look at this fat, juicy magnetic profile.  And it's mine, mine, mine.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Half mine, dear.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: And half mine!

Speaker: jorden
Dialogue: I got too many partners.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Daddy, when are we going back to town?

Speaker: jorden
Dialogue: When we get rich, Newt.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: You always say that.  I wanna go back.  I wanna play 'Monster Maze.'

Speaker: tim
Dialogue: You cheat too much.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Do not.  I'm just the best.

Speaker: tim
Dialogue: Do too!  You go in places we can't fit.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: So!  That's why I'm the best.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Knock it off!  I catch either of you playing in the air ducts again I'll tan your hides.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Mom.  All the kids play it...

Speaker: jorden
Dialogue: Holy shiiit!

Speaker: jorden
Dialogue: Folks, we have scored big this time.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: You kids stay inside.  I mean it!  We'll be right back.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Shouldn't we call in?

Speaker: jorden
Dialogue: Let's wait till we know what to call it in as.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: How about 'big weird thing'?

Speaker: tim
Dialogue: Cheater!

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Timmy...they've been gone a long time.

Speaker: tim
Dialogue: It'll be okay, Newt.  Dad knows what he's doing.

Speaker: anne
Dialogue: Mayday!  Mayday!  This is Alpha Kilo Two Four Niner calling Hadley Control. Repeat.  This is...

Speaker: bon
Dialogue: Best decision I ever made, Bill. We'll be starting a new life from scratch, in a clean world. No crime.  No unemployment...

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Hi, Ripley.  This is Lieutenant Gorman of the...

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Ripley we have to talk.  They've lost contact with the colony on Acheron.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No.  There's no way!

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Hear me out...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I was reamed, steamed and dry-cleaned by you guys...and now you want me to go back out there?  Forget it.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Look, we don't know what's going on out there.  It may just be a down transmitter.  But if it's not, I want you there...as an advisor.  That's all.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: You wouldn't be going in with the troops.  I can guarantee your safety.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: These Colonial Marines are some tough hombres, and they're packing state-of-the-art firepower. Nothing they can't handle...right, Lieutenant?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: We're trained to deal with these kinds of situations.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What about you?  What's your interest in this?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Well, the corporation co-financed that colony with the Colonial Administration, against mineral rights.  We're getting into a lot of terraforming...'Building Better Worlds.'

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah.  I saw the commercial.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I heard you were working in the cargo docks.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Running loaders, forklifts, that sort of thing?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: It's all I could get.  Anyway, it keeps my mind off of... everything.  Days off are worse.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: What if I said I could get you reinstated as a flight officer? And that the company has agreed to pick up your contract?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: If I go.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: If you go.  It's a second chance, kiddo.  And it'll be the best thing in the world for you to face this fear and beat it.  You gotta get back on the horse...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Spare me, Burke.  I've had my psych evaluation this month.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Yes, and I've read it.  You wake up every night, sheets soaking, the same nightmare over and over...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No!  The answer is no.  Now please go.  I'm sorry.  Just go, would you.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Think about it.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Yello?  Oh, Ripley.  Hi...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Burke, just tell me one thing. That you're going out there to kill them.  Not study.  Not bring back.  Just burn them out...clean ...forever.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: That's the plan.  My word on it.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: All right.  I'm in.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: And you my dear, are staying right here.

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: Arrgh.  I'm getting too old for this shit.

Speaker: drake
Dialogue: They ain't payin' us enough for this.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Not enough to have to wake up to your face, Drake.

Speaker: drake
Dialogue: Suck air.  Hey, Hicks...you look like I feel.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: This floor's freezing.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Christ.  I never saw such a buncha old women.  You want me to fetch your slippers, Hudson?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Would you, Sir?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hey, Vasquez...you ever been mistaken for a man?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: No.  Have you?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Hey, hand job, you take my towel?

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: I need some slack, man.  How come they send us straight back out like this?  We got some slack comin', man.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: You just got three weeks.

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: I mean breathing, not this frozen shit.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Yeah, 'Top'...what about it?

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: You know it ain't up to me.  Awright!  Let's knock off the grabass.  First assembly's in fifteen...let's shag it.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Who's the fresh meat again?

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: She's supposed to be some kinda consultant...  ...She was an alien once.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Whoooah!  No shit?  I'm impressed.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Let's go...let's go.  Cycle through!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hey, 'Top.'  What's the op?

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Rescue mission.  There's some juicy colonists' daughters we gotta rescue from virginity.

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: Shee-it.  Dumbass colonists. What's this crap supposed to be?

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: Cornbread, I think.  Hey, I wouldn't mind getting me some more a that Arcturan poontang.  Remember that time?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Looks like that new Lieutenant's too good to eat with us grunts.

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: Yeah.  Got a corn cob up his ass, definitely.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'm sorry you feel that way about Synthetics, Ripley.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You never said anything about an android being here!  Why not?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Well, it didn't occur to me.  It's been policy for years to have a synthetic on board.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I prefer the term 'artificial person' myself.  Is there a problem?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: A synthetic malfunctioned on her last trip out.  Some deaths were involved.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'm shocked.  Was it an older model?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Well, that explains it.  The A/2's were always a bit twitchy. That could never happen now with out behavioral inhibitors.  Impossible for me to harm or, by omission of action, allow to be harmed a human being.  More cornbread?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Just stay away from me, Bishop! You got that straight?

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: She don't like the cornbread either.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Tench-hut!

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: At ease.  I'm sorry we didn't have time to brief before we left Gateway but...

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Sir?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Yes, Hicks?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hudson, Sir.  He's Hicks.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: What's the question?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Is this going to be a stand-up fight, Sir, on another bug-hunt?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: All we know is that there's still no contact with the colony and that a xenomorph may be involved.

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: So what are these things?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I've dictated what I know on these.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Tease us a bit.

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: Yeah...previews.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Okay.  It's important to understand this organism's life cycle.  It's actually two creatures.  The first form hatches from a spore...a sort of large egg, and attaches itself to its victim.  Then it injects an embryo, detaches and dies. It's essentially a walking sex organ. The --

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Sounds like you, Hicks.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: ...then it...emerges.  Moults. Grows rapidly --

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: I only need to know one thing.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Where they are.

Speaker: drake
Dialogue: Yo!  Vasquez.  Kick ass!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Anytime.  Anywhere.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Somebody said alien...she thought they said illegal alien and signed up.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Fuck you.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Anytime.  Anywhere.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Am I disturbing you conversation Mr. Hudson?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I hope you're right.  I really do.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I suggest you study the disks Ripley has been kind enough to prepare for you.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Are there any questions?  Hudson?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: How do I get out of this chicken-shit outfit?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: All right.  I want this to go smooth and by the numbers.  I want DCS and tactical database assimilation by 0830.  Ordnance loading, weapons strip and drop-ship prep details will have seven hours...

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Attention.  This concluded final maneuvering operations.  Thank you for your cooperation.  You may resume work.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Still nothing from the colony?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Dead on all channels.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Clear, please.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I feel like a fifth wheel here.  Is there anything I can do?

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: I don't know.  Is there anything you can do?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I can drive that loader.  I've got a Class Two rating.  My latest career move.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Where you want it?

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Let's move it, girls!  On the ready line.  Let's go, let's go.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: I am ready, man.  Ready to get it on.  Check-it-out.  I am the ultimate badass...state of the badass art.  You do not want to fuck with me.  Hey, Ripley, don't worry.  Me and my squad of ultimate badasses will protect you. Check-it-out...

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Independently targetting particle-beam phalanx.  VWAP! Fry half a city with this puppy. We got tactical smart-missles, phased-plasma pulse-rifles, RPG's.  We got sonic eeelectronic ballbreakers, we got nukes, we got knives...sharp sticks --

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Save it.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Sure, Hicks.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Here we go.

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Initiate release sequencer on my mark.  Three.  Two.  One.  Mark!

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Switching to DCS ranging.

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: Two-four-o.  Nominal to profile. Picking up some hull ionization.

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Got it.  Rough air ahead.

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Stand by for some chop.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How may drops is this for you, Lieutenant?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Thirty-eight...simulated.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: How many combat drops?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Well...two.  Three, including this one.

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Turning on final.  Coming around to a seven-zero-niner.  Terminal guidance locked in.  Where's the damn beacon?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Let's see.  Everybody on line. Drake, check you camera.  There seems to be a...

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: ...that's better.  Pan it around a bit.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Awright.  Fire-team A.  Gear up. Let's move.  Two minutes. Somebody wake up Hicks.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: That the atmosphere processor?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Uh-hunh.  One of thirty or so, all over the planet.  They're completely automated.  We manufacture them, by the way.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Hold at forty.  Slow circle of the complex.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Okay, let's do it.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Awright!  I want a nice clean dispersal this time.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: You staying in here?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You bet.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Figures.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Set down sixty meters this side of the telemetry mast.  Immediate dust off on my 'clear,' then stay on station.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Ten seconds, people.  Look sharp!

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: First squad up, on line.  Hicks, get yours in a cordon.  Watch the rear.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Vasquez, take point.  Let's move.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Sealed.  Hudson, run a bypass.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: First squad, assemble on me at the main lock.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Second team, move up. Flanking positions.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Quarter and search by twos.  Second team move inside.  Hicks, take the upper level.  Use your motion trackers.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Nothing.  No movement.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Looks like my room in college.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Wait!  Tell him to...  ...Hicks.  Back up.  Pan left. There!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: You seeing this okay?  Looks melted.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Hmm.  Acid for blood.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Looks like somebody bagged them one of Ripley's bad guys here.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hey, if you like that, you're gonna love this...

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Second squad?  What's your status?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Just finished our sweep. Nobody home.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: The place is dead, Sir.  Whatever happened, we missed it.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: All right, the area's secured. Let's go in and see what their computer can tell us.  First team head for operations. Hudson, see if you can get their CPU on line.  Hicks, meet me at the south lock by the up-link tower...

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: ...We're coming in.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: He's coming in.  I feel safer already.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Pendejo jerkoff.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Sir, the CPU is on-line.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Okay, stand by in operations.  Let's go.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Burke!

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: Scare you?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Christ, Wierzbowski!

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: Sorry.  Hicks said to keep an eye on you.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Looks like you company can write off its share of this colony.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: It's insured.

Speaker: front
Dialogue: Sir, you should check this out...

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Right ahead here...

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: Last stand.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: No bodies?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: No, Sir.  Looks like it was a helluva fight.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Over there.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Are these the same...?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Watch it, Burke...

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: It likes you.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: These are dead.  There's just the two alive.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They killed him getting it off.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Poor bastard.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Behind us.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: One of us?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Apone...where are your people? Anybody in D-Block?

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Negative.  We're all in Operations.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: It's moving.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Which way?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: You fuck!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Come on out.  It's all right...

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Ow!  Shit.  Watchit, she bites.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: It's okay, it's okay.  It's over... you're going to be all right now... it's okay...you're safe...

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: What's her name again?

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Rebecca.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Now think, Rebecca. Concentrate.  Just start at the beginning...

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Where are your parents?  You have to try...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Gorman!  Give it a rest would you.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Total brain-lock.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Physically she's okay. Borderline malnutrition, but I don't think any permanent damage.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Come on, we're wasting our time.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Here, try this.  A little instant hot chocolate.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Poor thing.  You don't talk much do you?  That's okay by me.  Most people do a lot of talking and they wind up not saying very much.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Uh oh.  I made a clean spot here.  Now I've done it.  Guess I'll just have to do the whole thing.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hard to believe...there's a little girl under all this. And a pretty one at that.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: What's he scanning for?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: PDT'S.  Personal-Data Transmitters. Every adult colonist had one surgically implanted.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: If they're within twenty klicks we'll read it out here, but so far...zip.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I don't know how you managed to stay alive but you're one brave kid, Rebecca.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: N-newt.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Newt.  My n-name's Newt. Nobody calls me Rebecca except my dork brother.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Well, Newt it is then.  My name's Ripley...and people call me Ripley.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Pleased to meet you.  And who is this?  Does she have a name?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Casey.  She's my only friend.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What about me?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: I don't want you for a friend.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Oh, Newt.  You mom and dad went away like that, didn't they?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They'd be here if they could, honey.  I know they would.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: They're dead.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt.  Look at me...Newt.  I won't leave you.  I promise.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: You promise?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Cross my heart.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: And hope to die?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: And hope to die.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hah!  Stop your grinnin' and drop your linen!  Found 'em.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Alive?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Unknown.  But, it looks like all of them.  Over at the processing station...sublevel 'C' under the south tower.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Looks like a Goddamn town meeting.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Let's saddle up.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Awright, let's go girls, they ain't payin' us by the hour.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: I was the best at the game. I knew the whole maze.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: The 'maze'?  You mean the air ducts?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Yeah, you know.  In the walls, under the floor.  I was the ace.  I could hide better than anybody.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You're really something, ace.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Forty meters in.  Ramp on axial two-two.  Access to sublevels.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: B-Level.  Next one down.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: We're not making that out too well.  What is it?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: You tell me.  I only work here.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Proceed inside.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Oh God...

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Looks like some sort of secreted resin.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: They ripped apart the colony for building materials.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: And the colonists...When they were done with them.  Newt, you better go sit up front.  Go on.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Hotter'n hell in here.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Yeah...but it's a dry heat.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They're right under the primary heat exchangers.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Yeah?  Maybe the organisms like the heat, that's why they built...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: That's not what I mean.  Gorman, if your men have to use their weapons in there, they'll rupture the cooling system.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: She's right.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: So.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: So...then the fusion containment shuts down.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: So?  So?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: We're talking thermonuclear explosion.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Shit.  Apone, collect magazines from everybody.  We can't have any firing in there.

Speaker: wierzbowski
Dialogue: Is he fucking crazy?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: What're we supposed to use, man?  Harsh language?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Flame-units only.  I want rifles slung.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Let's go.  Pull 'em out.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: I always keep this handy. For close encounter.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Let's move.  Hicks, back us up.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Any movement?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Nothing.  Zip.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Sir!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Please...God...kill me.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Flame thrower!  Move!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Movement!

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Position?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Can't lock up...

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Talk to me, Hudson.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Uh, seems to be in front and behind.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: We can't see anything back here, Apone.  What's going on?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Pull you team out, Gorman.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Go to infrared.  Looks sharp people!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Multiple signals.  All round. Closing.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Let's rock.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Who's firing?  I ordered a hold fire, dammit!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Let's get the fuck out of here!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Not that tunnel, the other one!

Speaker: crowe
Dialogue: You sure?  Watch it...behind you.  Fucking move, will you!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: GET THEM OUT OF THERE!  DO IT NOW!

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Shut up.  Just shut up!

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Uh,...Apone, I want you to lay down a suppressing fire with the incinerators and fall back by squads to the APC, over.

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Say again?  All after incinerators?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: I said...

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Dietrich?  Crowe?  Sound off!  Wierzbowski?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: We're getting juked!  We're gonna die in here!

Speaker: apone
Dialogue: Yeah.  Right.  Right!  Fuck the heat exchanger!

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: I told them to fall back...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They're but off!  Do something!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt, put your seatbelt on!

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: Ripley, what the hell...?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: What are you doing?  Turn around!  That's an order!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Drake!  He's down!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: He's gone!  Forget it, he's gone!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: No.. No, he's not.  He's --

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Let's go!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Get on the Goddamn door!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: It's okay...we're clear.  We're clear.  Ease up.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Sounds like a blown transaxle. You're just grinding metal.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt?  Where's Newt?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Jesus...Jesus...I don't believe it.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: I'm all right, leave it!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: He's alive.  I think he's paralyzed.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: He's fucking dead!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Wake up pendejo!  I'm gonna kill you, you useless fuck!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Hold it.  Hold it.  Back off, right now.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Looks like it stung him.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hey...hey!  Look, Crowe and Dietrich aren't dead, man.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: They must be like Gorman.  Their signs are real low but they ain't dead!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You can't help them.  Right now they're being cocooned just like the others.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Oh, God.  Jesus.  This ain't happening.

Speaker: spunkmeyer
Dialogue: Need anything else?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: All right, we can't blow the fuck out of them...why not roll some canisters of CN-20 down there. Nerve gas the whole nest?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Look, man, let's just bug out and call it even, okay?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No good.  How do we know it'll effect their biochemistry?  I say we take off and nuke the entire site from orbit.  It's the only way to be sure.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Now hold on a second.  I'm not authorizing that action.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Well, I mean...I know this is an emotional moment, but let's not make snap judgments.  Let's move cautiously.  First, this physical installation had a substantial dollar value attached to it --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They can bill me.  I got a tab running.  What's second?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: This is clearly an important species we're dealing with here. We can't just arbitrarily exterminate them --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Bullshit!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Yeah, bullshit.  Watch us.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Maybe you haven't been keeping up on current events, but we just got out asses kicked, pal!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Look, Burke.  We had an agreement.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I know, I know, but we're dealing with changing scenarios here.  This thing is major, Ripley.  I mean really major.  You gotta go with its energy.  Since you are the representative of the company who discovered this species your percentage will naturally be some serious, serious money.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You son of a bitch.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Don't make me pull rank, Ripley.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What rank?  I believe Corporal Hicks has authority here.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Corporal Hicks!?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: This operation is under military jurisdiction and Hicks is next in chain of command.  Right?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Looks that way.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Look, this is a multimillion dollar operation.  He can't make that kind of decision.  He's just a grunt!  No offense.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Ferro, you copying?

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Standing by.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Prep for dust-off.  We're gonna need an immediate evac.  I think we'll take off and nuke the site from orbit.  It's the only way to be sure.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: This is absurd!  You don't have the authority to --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: We're going home, honey.

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Spunkmeyer?  Goddammit.

Speaker: ferro
Dialogue: Where the fu --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Well that's great!  That's just fucking great, man.  Now what the fuck are we supposed to do, man? We're in some real pretty shit now!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Are you finished?  You okay?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: I guess we're not leaving, right?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Newt.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: You don't have to be sorry.  It wasn't your fault.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Just tell me what the fuck we're supposed to do now.  What're we gonna do now?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: May be could build a fire and sing songs.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: We should get back, 'cause it'll be dark soon.  They come mostly at night.  Mostly.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: This is all we could salvage.  We've got four pulse-rifles with about fifty rounds each.  Not so good. About fifteen M-40 grenades and two flame throwers less than half full...one damaged.  And We've got four of these robot-sentry units with scanners and display intact.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How long after we're declared overdue can we expect a rescue?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: About seventeen days.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Man, we're not going to make it seventeen hours!  Those things are going to come in here, just like they did before, man... they're going to come in here and get us, man, long before...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: She survived longer than that with no weapons and no training.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: So you better just start dealing with it.  Just deal with it, Hudson...because we need you and I'm tired of your bullshit.  Now get on a terminal and call up some kind of floor plan file. Construction blueprints, maintenance schematics, anything that shows the layout of this place.  I want to see air ducts, electrical access tunnels, subbasements.  Every possible way into this wing.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Aye-firmative.  I'm on it.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'll be in medical.  I'd like to continue my analysis.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Fine.  You do that.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: This service tunnel is how they're moving back and forth.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Yeah, right, it runs from the processing station right into the sublevel here.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: All right.  There's a fire door at this end.  The first thing we do is put a remote sentry in the tunnel and seal that door.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: We gotta figure on them getting into the complex.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: That's right.  So we put up welded barricades at these intersections...  ...and seal these ducts here and here.  Then they can only come at us from these two corridors and we create a free field of fire for the other two sentry units, here.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Outstanding.  Then all we need's a deck of cards.  All right, let's move like we got a purpose.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Aye-firmative.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Aye-firmative!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Testing!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Hudson here.  A and B sentries are in place and keyed.  We're sealing the tunnel.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Roger.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Here, put this on.  Then I can locate you anywhere in the complex on this --

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Just a...precaution.  You know.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Uh, what's next?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Now you just lie here and have a nap.  You're exhausted.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: I don't want to...I have scary dreams.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I'll bet Casey doesn't have bad dreams.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Nothing bad in here.  Maybe you could just try to be like her.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Ripley...she doesn't have bad dreams because she's just a piece of plastic.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Oh.  Sorry, Newt.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: My mommy always said there were no monsters.  No real ones.  But there are.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Yes, there are, aren't there.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Why do they tell little kids that?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Well, some kids can't handle it like you can.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Did one of those things grow inside her?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I don't know, Newt.  That's the truth.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Isn't that how babies come? I mean people babies...they grow inside you?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No, it's different, honey.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Did you ever have a baby?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Yes.  A little girl.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Gone.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: You mean dead.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Ripley, I was just thinking... Maybe I could do you a favor and fill in for her.  Just for a while.  You can try it and if you don't like it, it's okay. I'll understand.  No big deal. Whattya think?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I think it's not the worst idea I've heard all day.  Let's talk about it later.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Don't go!  Please.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I'll be right in the other room, Newt.  And look...I can see you on that camera right up there.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Here.  Take is for luck.  Now go to sleep...and don't dream.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How is he?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I've isolated a neuro-muscular toxin responsible for the paralysis.  It seems to be metabolizing.  He should wake up soon.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Now let me get this straight. The aliens paralyzed the colonists, carried them over there, cocooned them to be hosts for more of those...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Which would mean lots of those parasites, right?  One for each person...over a hundred at least.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Yes.  That follows.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: But these things come from eggs...so where are all the eggs coming from.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: That is the question of the hour.  We could assume a parallel to certain insect forms who have hivelike organization. An ant of termite colony, for example, is ruled by a single female, a queen, which is the source of new eggs.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You're saying one of those things lays all the eggs?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Well, the queen is always physically larger then the others.  A termite queen's abdomen is so bloated with eggs that it can't move at all.  It is fed and tended by drone workers, defended by the warriors.  She is the center of their lives, quite literally the  mother of their society.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Could it be intelligent?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Hard to say.  It may have been blind instinct...attraction to the heat of whatever...but she did choose to incubate her eggs in the one spot where we couldn't destroy her without destroying ourselves.  That's if she exists, of course.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I want those specimens destroyed as soon as you're done with them. You understand?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Mr. Burke have instructions that they were to be kept alive in stasis for return to the company labs.  He was very specific.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Burke!

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Those specimens are worth millions to the bio-weapons division.  Now, if you're smart we can both come out of this heroes.  Set up for life.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You just try getting a dangerous organism past ICC quarantine. Section 22350 of the Commerce Code.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: You've been doing your homework. Look, they can't impound it if they don't know about it.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: But they will know about it, Burke. From me.  Just like they'll know how you were responsible for the deaths of one hundred and fifty-seven colonists here --

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Now, wait a second --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You sent them to that ship.  I just checked the colony log... directive dates six-twelve-seventy-nine. Signed Burke, Carter J.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You sent them out there and you didn't even warn them, Burke. Why didn't you warn them?

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Look, maybe the thing didn't even exist, right?  And if I'd made it a major security situation, the Administration would've stepped in.  Then no exclusive rights, nothing.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: It was a bad call, that's all.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Bad call?  These people are fucking dead, Burke!  Well, they're going to nail your hide to the shed... and I'll be there when they do.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: I expected more of you, Ripley. I thought you would be smarter than this.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Sorry to disappoint you.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: They're coming.  They're in the tunnel.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Guns A and B.  Tracking and firing on multiple targets.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: They must be wall to wall in there.  Look  at those ammo counters go.  It's a shooting gallery down there.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: B gun's dry.  Twenty on A. Ten.  Five.  That's it.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They're at the fire door.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Man, listen to that.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Bishop here.  I'm afraid I have some bad news.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Well, that's a switch.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: That's it.  See it?  Emergency venting.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How long until it blows?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'm projecting total systems failure in a little under four hours.  The blast radius will be about thirty kilometers.  About equal to ten megatons.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: We got problems.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: I don't fucking believe this. Do you believe this?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: And it's too late to shut it down?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'm afraid so.  The crash did too much damage.  The overload is inevitable, at this point.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Oh, man.  And I was gettin' short, too!  Four more weeks and out. Now I'm gonna buy it on this fuckin' rock.  It ain't half fair, man!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Hudson, give us a break.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: We need the other drop-ship.  The on one the Sulaco.  We have to bring it down on remote, somehow.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: How?  The transmitter was on the APC.  It's wasted.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I don't care how!  Think of a way.  Think of something.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Think of what?  We're fucked.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What about the colony transmitter? That up-link tower down at the other end.  Why can't we use that?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I checked.  The hard wiring between here and there was severed in the fighting.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Well then somebody's just going to have to go out there.  Take a portable terminal and go out there and plug in manually.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Oh, right!  Right!  With those things running around.  No way.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'll go.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'm really the only one qualified to remote-pilot the ship anyway. Believe me, I'd prefer not to.  I may be synthetic but I'm not stupid.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: All right.  Let's get on it.  What'll you need?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Listen.  It's stopped.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Well, they're into the complex.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: This duct runs almost to the up-link assembly.  One hundred eighty meters.  Say, forty minutes to crawl down there.  One hour to patch in and align the antenna. Thirty minutes to prep the ship, then about fifty minutes flight time.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: It's going to be closer.  You better get going.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: See you soon.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: They're in the approach corridor.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: On my way.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Twenty meters and closing. Fifteen.  C and D guns down about fifty percent.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Now many?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Can't tell.  Lots.  D gun's down to twenty.  Ten.  It's out.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They retreated.  The guns stopped them.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Yeah.  But look...

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Newt time then can walk right up and knock.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: But they don't know that.  They're probably looking for other ways to get in.  That'll take them awhile.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Maybe we got 'em demoralized.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: I want you two walking the perimeter. I know we're all in strung out shape but stay frosty and alert. We've got to stop any entries before they get out of hand.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: How long since you slept? Twenty-four hours?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They'll get us.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Maybe.  Maybe not.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hicks, I'm not going to wind up like those others.  You'll take care of it won't you, it if comes to that?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: If it comes to that, I'll do us both.  Let's see that it doesn't Here, I'd like to introduce you to a close personal friend of mine.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: M-41A 10mm pulse-rifle, over and under with a 30mm pump-action grenade launcher.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What do I do?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Just pull it in real right.  It will kick some.  When the counter here heads zero, hit this...

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Just let it drop right out.  Get the other one in quick.  Just slap it in hard, it likes abuse. Now, pull the bolt.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: You're ready again.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Well, that's the grenade launcher ...you probably don't want to mess with that.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Look, you started this.  Now show me everything.  I can handle myself.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Yeah.  I've noticed.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: How do you feel?

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: All right, I guess.  One hell of a hangover.  Look, Ripley... I...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: You still want to kill me?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: It won't be necessary.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: There, there.  Sssshh.  It's all right.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Now, if I did it right...

Speaker: female voice
Dialogue: Attention.  Attention.  Automatic fueling operations have begun. Please extinguish all smoking materials.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt.  Newt, wake up.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Wah...?  Where are...?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Sssh.  Don't move.  We're in trouble.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hey...hey!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hicks!  Hicks!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: He's at the up-link tower.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Excellent.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Mommy...mommmyyyyy...

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Mommy...I mean, Ripley...I'm scared.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I know, honey.  Me too.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Vasquez, Hudson, meet me in medical!  We got a fire!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: The corner!  Ready?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Do it!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Burke...it was Burke.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: I say we grease this rat-fuck son of a bitch right now!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: I don't get it.  It doesn't make any Goddamn sense.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: He wanted an alien, only he couldn't get it back through quarantine.  But if we were impregnated ...whatever you call it...and then frozen for the trip back at just the right time...then nobody would know about the embryos we were carrying. We and Newt.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Wait a minute.  We'd know about it.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: The only way it would work is if he sabotaged certain freezers on the trip back.  Then he could jettison the bodies and make up any story he liked.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Fuuuck!  He's dead.  You're dogmeat, pal.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: This is total paranoid delusion. It's pitiful.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You know, Burke, I don't know which species is worse.  You don't see them screwing each other over for a fucking percentage.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: No offense.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Just find someplace to lock him up until it's time to --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They cut the power.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: What do you mean, they cut the power?  How could they cut the power, man?  They're animals.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt!  Stay close.  Let's get some trackers going. Come on, get moving.  Gorman, watch Burke.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Anything?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: There's something.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: It's inside the complex.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: You're just reading me.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: No.  No!  It ain't you.  They're inside.  Inside the perimeter. They're in here.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hudson, stay cool.  Vasquez?

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Hudson may be right.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: It's game time.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Get back here, both of you.  Fall back to Operations.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: This signal's weird...must be some interference or something. There's movement all over the place...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Just get back here!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Movement!  Signal's clean.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Range twenty meters.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Seal the door.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Seventeen meters.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Let's get these things lit.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They learned.  They cut the power and avoided the guns.  They must have found another way in, something we missed.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: We didn't miss anything.

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Fifteen meters.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: I don't know, an acid hole in a duct.  Something under the floors, not on the plans. I don't know!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Twelve meters.  Man, this is a big fucking signal.  Ten meters.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: They're right on us.  Vasquez, how you doing?

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Nine meters.  Eight.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Can't be.  That's inside the room!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: It's readin' right.  Look!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Well you're not reading it right!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Six meters.  Five.  What the fu --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Medical!  Get to medical!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Burke!  Open the door!

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: hudson
Dialogue: Let's go!  Let's go!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Fuckin' A!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Hold you fire!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Locked.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Stand back.

Speaker: gorman
Dialogue: You can't use those in here!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Right.  Fire in the hole!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Thanks a lot!  Now I can't hear shit.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Come on!  This way.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Stay behind me.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Come on.  Crawl faster.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: DO you know how to get to the landing field from here?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Sure.  Go left.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Go right.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Bishop, you read me?  Come in, over.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Yes, I read you.  Not very well...

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: The ship is on its way.  ETA about sixteen minutes.  I've got my hands full flying... the weather's come up a bit.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: All right, stand by there.  We're on out way.  Over.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Back.  Go back!

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: Losing fuel.

Speaker: vasquez
Dialogue: You always were an asshole, Gorman.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: This way.  Come on, we're almost there!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt, wait!

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Here!  Go up.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Just up there --

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Riiiiipppleee --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt!

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Mommy...where are you?

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Moooommeeee...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hicks, get down here.  I need that locator.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt!  Star wherever you are!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: This way.  We're close...

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Here!  I'm here.  I'm here.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Climb down, honey.  We have to cut through this grate.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt!  Newt!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No!  Noooo!

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: She's gone!  Let's go!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: No!  No!  She's alive!  We have to --

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: All right!  She's alive.  I believe it.  But we gotta get moving!  Now!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Come on, you can make it. Almost there.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: HOW MUCH TIME?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: PLENTY!  TWENTY-SIX MINUTES!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: WE'RE NOT LEAVING!

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Ripley...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: She's alive.  They brought her here and you know it.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: In seventeen minutes this place will be a cloud of vapor the size of Nebraska.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Hicks, don't let him leave.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: We ain't going anywhere.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: See you, Hicks.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Dwayne.  It's Dwayne.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Ellen.

Speaker: hicks
Dialogue: Don't be long, Ellen.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Attention.  Emergency.  All personnel must evacuate immediately.  You now have fourteen minutes to reach minimum safe distance.

Speaker: burke
Dialogue: Ripley...help me.  I can feel it...inside.  Oh, God...it's moving!  Oh gooood...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You now have eleven minutes to reach minimum safe distance.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: I knew you'd come.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Newt, I want you to hang on, now.  Hang on tight.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You now have two minutes to reach minimum safe distance.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: BISHOP!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: BISHOP!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Close your eyes, baby.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You now have thirty seconds to reach...

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Punch it, Bishop!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: It's okay, baby.  We made it.  It's over.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I gave him a shot, for the pain. We'll need to get a stretcher to cart him up to medical.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I'm sorry if I gave you a scare but that platform was just becoming too unstable...

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: I had to circle and hope things didn't get too rough to take you off.

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: You did okay, Bishop.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Well, thanks, I --

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Here!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Get away from her, you bitch!

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Not bad for a human.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Mommy...Mommy?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Right here, baby.  Right here.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Are we going to sleep now?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: newt
Dialogue: Can we dream?

Speaker: ripley
Dialogue: Yes, honey.  I think we both can.
